title: index error after saving labels and going to next frame
body:
**Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):** - OS: macOS 11.2 - DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.9, 2.1.10.1 - DeepLabCut mode: single animal - Browser, if applicable [e.g. chrome, safari] **To Reproduce** 1. Create project, add video, extract frames. 2. Open label frames GUI, and label first frame. 3. Click Save 4. Click Next 4. See error:
TRACEBACK

```python pythonw -m deeplabcut Starting GUI... Found new frames.. Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/brandonjackson/opt/miniconda3/envs/dlc/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/labeling_toolbox.py", line 767, in nextImage self.updatedCoords = MainFrame.getLabels(self, self.iter) File "/Users/brandonjackson/opt/miniconda3/envs/dlc/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/labeling_toolbox.py", line 845, in getLabels self.dataFrame[self.scorer][bp]["x"].values[self.iter], IndexError: index 1 is out of bounds for axis 0 with size 1 ```

**Additional context** Discussed on the [forum](https://forum.image.sc/t/label-frames-dataframe-index-out-of-bounds-error/48653/4). The `Found new frames..` message only prints after the save, upon clicking Next. The error does not occur on these installations when just labelling and then clicking next. The saved data are complete for the labeled frames, but unlabeled (i.e. not viewed) frame paths are not saved into `CollectedData...csv`. Obviously, saving is not absolutely necessary after each frame, but when applying 30 labels per image it might provide some peace-of-mind. Otherwise, "Save" should be "Save & Quit".
